pros: Healthy Work Environment Team players Good pay
cons: Turnover (No other cons )

pros:
More caring than the other hospitals I have worked at. Union is strong. Pay is good. Benefits are great. Safe. 
Upper management tries to keep a supportive and caring environment for all. They also try to hire managers that do the same.
cons: Not all supervisors are treating employees as they should, nor following rules for allowing days off or allowing you to have resource personnel work days for you. Keeps resource personnel short on hours so they will come in at short notice. Expectation is to have to get work done too fast for patient safety or comfort. Management in other state keeps resources for this hospital too tight.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Springfield, OR
pros: Small, people-focused Sense of Community My department did not tolerate poor patient behavior, which is rare.
cons: Lower pay than competitors High patient ratios Demanding physically and mentally

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Springfield, OR
pros: Great staff, really great staff. Everyone is super nice!
cons: Short staffed often, they float anyone and everyone everywhere with little to no orientation. The contract states this isn’t allowed. They still do it.

review_title: Was good. Now a horrible place to work
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Springfield, OR
pros: The hospital is staffed with amazing people who are dedicated to their jobs.
cons: The upper management has destroyed the moral . It is cost cutting at every section. They don’t stand up for employees. The executive team is a group of amateur’s who think they are way better than they are. They are outwardly demeaning in meetings and try to manage the safety and well-being of patient care as if there we not lives attached to their decisions.

pros: Close working relationship with other staff. Amazing services!
cons: Owned by out of state company, they don’t always understand what we, as staff, need.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Eugene, OR
pros: Great nursing culture and teamwork.
cons: Understaffed in every department. Out-of-state, corporate owned.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Springfield, OR
pros: Wonderfully kind patients who value hard working staff.
cons: Poor communication between management, physicians, nurses, and staff. Unit's do not work as a team as well as they could. The facility does not feel friendly to new employees, poor training program, horrible e-mar, redundant and excessive duplicate documentation. Morale is low, though thankfully the employees have not let the patients know how low. Patients expressed frustration daily on features such as co-rooming/co-bathrooms, sharing TV's, size and clarity of televisions, quality, freshness, warmth and variety of food, inability to shower/clean themselves/receive assistance with full bathing, once a day physical therapy that consists of 10 minutes getting into a chair from the bed, or walking 20 feet in the halls.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Springfield, OR
pros: Strong Union support and influence. People are for the most part great to work with. Wages are great compared to national average. Offers Double time for short staffing
cons: Short staffed constantly. No throughput. No bed flow. No identity for floors. Medical overflow everywhere. Reactionary not preventative staffing and planning. Acuity ebb and flows. Training and education are spotty at best and reliant on patient population at the time.

pros: Good people to work with
cons:
Low pay
Don't attempt to keep good workers

pros: Pay, union, double time offered
cons: Short staffed, poor training, inconsistent patient population and acuity

job_title: Registered Nurse, Critical Care in Raleigh, NC
pros: Great nursing culture. Nice area to work.
cons: Chronically understaffed... just like everywhere else in the country.

pros: Great people and a atmosphere
cons: Get paid less then neighboring hospital

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Springfield, OR
pros: Excellent management, great coworkers, adequate benefits
cons: schedule, schedule, schedule, schedule, schedule

pros: Teamwork and feels like a family
cons: Don't always have all supplies needed

pros: High pay for this position, Awesome differential, Union reps that listen, unbeatable benefits, 3 to 4 day work weeks with rotating weekends, awesome shift selections, staff is for the most part is friendly and professional.
cons: Management does not respect your personal life. It's really hard to get time off if you need to move or even have doctors appointments. They do not work around your school schedule at all. Generally, you have to ask for time off 6 mo in advance to get it and even then you will often get denied even if you have PTO accrued.

pros: New parts of the building are nice? The gift shop has cute things and delicious treats. Their staff are very nice.
cons:
A general culture of laziness exists. Majority of staff are only there for the paycheck. Main concern is getting to go on all of their smoke breaks. If they don't finish something they just dump it on the next shift. Patient care and quality are secondary.  Managers are totally clueless.
ER 30min pledge is nonsense. It means a PA will walk past you within 30min, not that you will have any sort of meaningful evaluaiton.

pros: Lab staff is very knowledgable about their profession, highly skilled. Pay is good due to union.
cons: Retirement benefit is terrible. Workplace culture in the lab is unwelcoming, focused on pressure and blame rather than support, with high turnover as a result.

pros: Working with the pts is a joy, working with the public is awesome, The nurses are important as much as the providers
cons: There really is no cons. Very Family oriented

pros: Warm family centered work environment, high standards for excellence, strong leadership support, great pay and benefits.
cons: None, have had no complaints thus far

pros: Wonderful co workers and great pay for the area
cons: Union constrictions and questionable tactics from the CFO
